question_stem: Which of the following statements are true regarding simulation modeling?
question_stem_html: Which of the following statements are true regarding simulation modeling?

choices.explanation: This is not true. Real-world data should be used to calibrate the model. False

choices.text: Simulation can be used to make predictions.
choices.explanation: Simulation models do not make predictions of random variables. They estimate means. False.

choices.text: Random variables that are used in simulation must follow a Normal distribution.
choices.explanation: The random variables do not need to follow a Normal. Think of rolling a die, for instance.

choices.text: Simulation can be used for scenario-planning purposes.
choices.explanation: Yes, this is precisely what they are for

choices.text: Simulation relies on the Central Limit Theorem.
Simulation is used to estimate means.
Simulation cannot be used to estimate proportions.
choices.explanation: Proportions are also means, so simulation models can be used to estimate means.

choices.text: Simulation results are always deterministic and predictable.
choices.explanation: Since they rely on random variables, simulation models are neither deterministic nor predictable. False.

choices.text: Simulation can be used to analyze systems with complex interactions.
Simulation often involves the use of random variables to mimic real-world uncertainty.

items.solution_html:
Correct statements: D, E, F, I, J.

  • D — scenario planning
  • E — CLT supports Monte Carlo estimators
  • F — estimate means via simulation
  • I — suitable for complex interactions
  • J — uses random variables to model uncertainty
